description.narrative: Communication for Social Change - Communication for Development (C4D) and Communication for Social Change (C4SC) is positioned as a cross-cutting and evidence-based strategy that is integral to development programmes and humanitarian work

sector.narrative: Capacity and skills development for social behaviour change
Research, monitoring and evaluation and knowledge management for C4D
Technical assistance - Cross-sectoral communication for development

title.narrative: UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
Baltic States (Europe and Central Asia Regional) Evaluation Reports
Europe and Central Asia Regional Office 2018 Annual Report
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Communication for Social Change - Communication for Development (C4D) and Communication for Social Change (C4SC) is positioned as a cross-cutting and evidence-based strategy that is integral to development programmes and humanitarian work

description.narrative: In 2019, RO C4D continued the development of resources and tools and strengthening of regional C4D capacities to address behavioral bottlenecks and improve the quality of behavior and social change interventions. C4D ECARO explored and expanded opportunities to build communication and community mobilization capacities of social service workforce and strengthen engagement at municipal level, including through mobilizing academia, civil society and local municipalities. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/01/2020

title.narrative: Interreligious engagement plan completed to mobilize religious leaders in advocacy with governments, parliamentarians and non-government decision makers to foster integration of children on the move.

Number of COs meeting at least one quality standard for each of the organizational benchmarks on C4D programming (budgeting, coordination, evidence generation and use, capacity development, community engagement), in at least half of programme areas applying C4D strategies.

Number of COs meeting at least two quality standards for each of the organizational benchmarks on C4D programming (budgeting, coordination, evidence generation and use, capacity development, community engagement), in at least half of programme areas applying C4D strategies.
